name: Trends in Neuroscience
description: Current research covering the breadth of neuroscience is show cased by members of the Collaborative Program in Neuroscience. These topical reports cover the spectrum from molecular through genetic, cellular, developmental, systems, behavioural and modelling. As well, approaches to studying neurodegenerative diseases and clinical neurophysiology are introduced.
prerequisites: 14 FCE complete, HMB300H1/ HMB310H1/ HMB320H1/ HMB360H1/ CJH332H1 (formerly CSB332H1)
